title: Cruise Ship Navigation Training: Simulation-Based Practical Competency Strengthening Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic ship maneuvering skills and intermediate understanding of navigation theory
context.additional_context: A course for current practitioners to enhance cruise ship navigation skills through simulation training that mirrors real-world work environments, combining hands-on practice with digital tools, debriefing sessions, and formative assessment-based monitoring of learning outcomes.

learning_goals: Learners perform cruise ship maneuvering techniques using Azipod propulsion systems in simulated high-sea conditions with 85% accuracy.
Learners are evaluated on their ability to analyze errors and propose improvement plans during the debriefing process after simulation training (4 or higher on a 5-point scale).
Learners are assessed on decision-making and collaboration skills in scenarios resembling actual navigation tasks through team-based project performance (achieving level 3 or higher on a rubric).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
